Instrument.name: Mars Global Surveyor Spacecraft Electron Reflectometer
Instrument.description: The Mars Global Surveyor (MGS) Spacecraft Electron Reflectometer (ER) was an instrument used to study the properties of Mars' ionosphere, specifically how it interacts with solar wind and the Martian atmosphere. It measured the density and energy of electrons in the ionosphere by reflecting electrons off the spacecraft's surface and analyzing the reflected signal. The data gathered helped scientists understand the structure and behavior of the ionosphere, including its influence on radio communications and how Mars' atmosphere responds to solar radiation. This research was key in uncovering how the Martian atmosphere might have evolved over time and its ability to retain an atmosphere in the face of solar wind.
